title: Why does Star Trek use naval ranks? - Quora
tags: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine (TV Series)
Star Trek: The Next Generation (TV series)

response.answer_text: Because Starfleet is a space navy. People will argue until they’re blue in the fact that it’s not military because Gene Roddenberry said so, but in TOS he had them having a rigid rank-based hierarchy, flying around doing military stuff like projecting governmental power, fighting wars, and the like, havIng court martials for people who disobey orders, doing covert ops against hostile governments, etc. so if that isn’t a military, I’d hate to imagine what is I mean, having a ship with enough firepower to lay waste to an entire planet’s surface is beyond the wildest fantasies of the most paranoid anti government militias but Starfleet has its General Order 24 It’s a space navy

Two reasons: Starfleet is a military, and any argument to the contrary may be summarily dismissed via the “if it quacks like a duck” argument, which is unassailable in this caseNaval ranks sound cooler than Army, Air Force or Marine ranks (and this from an Air Force vet)
